newsitem.title: USA: Heartland Wireless gets OK for junk deal-sources.
newsitem.headline: Heartland Wireless gets OK for junk deal-sources.

text.p: Heartland Wireless Communications Inc reached an agreement with its existing bondholders that will allow the company to issue an additional $125 million in high-yield bonds, sources familiar with the situation said on Wednesday.
Under the agreement, the company will pay the holders of its $96.01 million in outstanding bonds a fee of about $6 million in exchange for their consent to go ahead with the deal.
An official with Heartland declined to confirm or deny that an agreement had been reached.
The consent solicitation offer expires at 1700 EST/2200 GMT, the official said.

"That's an incredibly high fee," said one high-yield cable analyst who declined to be named. "A six point consent solicitation fee plus a likely three point underwriting fee will make this junk deal very expensive for the issuer."
Heartland will use the proceeds from the junk bond offering to expand its wireless cable system which operates primarily in rural areas in the U.S., the sources said.
The indenture of Heartland's $96.01 million in outstanding bonds stipulates that the company must receive bondholder consent before raising additional capital.
The sources said payment of the fee is contingent on completion of the 144a private placement of $125 million in senior notes due 2004 which is expected to be priced over the next two week.
BT Securities will serve as lead underwriter of the offering, the sources said.
Heartland Wireless is headquartered in Durant, Okla. -212-859-1662
